titles.title: Investment Tax Credit Act of 2001
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a temporary incentive for investing in tangible property in the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 10/16/2001--Introduced. Investment Tax Credit Act of 2001 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an investment credit for certain investment credit property acquired, completed, or placed in service within 18 months of enactment. Covers tangible personal property and other non-building tangible property as specified.Makes such property ineligible for other investment credits (energy or rehabilitation).
